oai_dc:dc.dc:title: For Intelligent Northern Farmers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture; Settlements; Farming; Pamphlets; Railroads
Agriculture; Killebrew, J. B. (Joseph Buckner), 1831-1906; Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 8 page, softcover pamphlet describing settlement opportunities for Northern farmers along the Nashville, Chattanooga and St. Louis Railway.

New South advocate and first Tennessee Commissioner of Agriculture, Joseph B. Killebrew, was born May 29, 1831 in Montgomery County, Tennessee. At Killebrew's urging and in response to the demands of like-minded farmers, the Tennessee General Assembly established a Bureau of Agriculture in December 1871. In 1894 he became immigration agent for the Nashville, Chattanooga and St. Louis Railroad.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway
